item.title: Beck's Depression Inventory
item.description: made by [[Aaron T Beck]] published in 1961 Introduction 21-item, self-report rating inventory measures characteristic attitudes and symptoms of depression mood, pessimism, sense of failure, self-dissatisfaction, guilt, punishment, self-dislike, self-accusation, suicidal ideas, crying, irritability, social withdrawal, indecisiveness, body image change, work difficulty, insomnia, fatigability, loss of appetite, weight loss, somatic preoccupation, and loss of libido.

item.title: Exam Tips - Journalism
item.description: Current Affairs Structure of Newsroom and structures Stringers, editors, all those roless Should be prepared to write a hard news article interviews - prepare an interview profile of a celebrity - profile writing - before interview analytical questions editing an article, copyediting marks FOR ANSWERS - Write - introduction characteristics examples

item.title: Psychology Sem IV modules

item.title: Sem IV English Syllabus
item.description: Module 1: The Essay [[A Room of Ones Own|Room of One’s Own]] - [[Virginia Woolf]] [[The Character of Dogs]] by [[Robert Louis Stevenson]] [[Advice to Youth]]- [[Mark Twain]] Module 2 : The Poetry [[Partition by WH Auden]] [[Sailing to Byzantium]] by [[WB Yeats]] [[Preludes]] by [[TS Eliot]] [[Dawn At Puri]] by [[Jayanta Mahapatra]] [[America - Allen Ginsberg]] by [[Allen Ginsberg]] [[Imagine - John Lennon]] by John Lennon Module 3 : The Novel & Drama The Moon and Six Pence- William Somerset Maugham [[The Moon and Six Pence]] [[A Portrait of the Artist as a Young Man]] - James Joyce [[Nagamandala]] - Girish Karnad Module 4 Visual Texts [[Schindler’s List]] [[Pygmalion]] by [[George Bernard Shaw]]
